tudatpy.elements¶

keplerian2cartesian(mu, a, ecc, inc, raan, argp, nu)[source]¶

Function to convert Keplerian state to cartesian.

Parameters

  • mu (float) – Standard gravitational parameter (m^3 / s^2).

  • a (float) – Semi-major axis (m).

  • ecc (float) – Eccentricity (-).

  • inc (float) – Inclination (rad).

  • raan (float) – Right Ascension of the Ascending Node (rad).

  • argp (float) – Argument of Perigee (rad).

  • nu (float) – True anomaly (rad).

Returns

cartesian_state – Cartesian state represented as [Rx, Ry, Rz, Vx, Vz, Vy] with distance in (m) and speed in (m/s).

Return type

ndarray

spherical2cartesian(r, lat, lon, speed, fpa, heading)[source]¶

Function to convert spherical state to cartesian.

Parameters

  • r (float) – Position vector magnitude (m).

  • lat (float) – Latitude (m).

  • lon (float) – Longitude (m).

  • speed (float) – Magnitude of velocity (m).

  • fpa (float) – Flight path angle (rad).

  • heading (float) – Heading angle (rad).

Returns

cartesian_state – Cartesian state represented as [Rx, Ry, Rz, Vx, Vz, Vy] with distance in (m) and speed in (m/s).

Return type

ndarray
